sentences.en: All donations of HK $ 100 or above are tax deductible.
sentences.cn: 捐款港币$100或以上,可获发正式收据向税务局申请免税.

sentences.en: Also, interest paid on bonds is a tax deductible business expense for the corporation.
sentences.cn: 另外, 债券的利息属于公司的营业开支,可以减税.

sentences.en: But, in practice, interest payments are generally tax - deductible; dividends are not.
sentences.cn: 但在实践中, 支付的利息通常是可减税的; 红利则不行.

sentences.en: Donation of HK $ 100 or above are tax deductible with a receipt.
sentences.cn: 捐款港币$100或以上可凭收据申请扣税.

sentences.en: Donation of HK $ 100 or above is deductible with a receipt.
sentences.cn: 捐款HK$100或以上可凭收据申请扣减税项.

sentences.en: Donation of HK $ 100 or above tax - deductible with an official receipt.
sentences.cn: 捐款港币一百元或以上可凭正式收据扣税.

sentences.en: Each time they go to a hospital, they have to pay a deductible of $628.
sentences.cn: 每次他们去医院，他们必须缴纳免赔费用628美元。

sentences.en: Expenses are deductible only to the extent that in aggregate they exceed 7 percent of gross income.
sentences.cn: 只有在消费总额超过总收入的7%时才可免税。

sentences.en: Keep track of tax-deductible expenses, such as the supplies and equipment you buy.
sentences.cn: 记下可减免课税的开支，比如买的原料和设备。

sentences.en: Money spent on business expenses is deductible.
sentences.cn: 业务方面的开支是可扣除税款的.

sentences.en: Part of the auto-loan interest is deductible as a business expense.
sentences.cn: 作为一项业务支出，汽车消费的部分贷款利息是可以扣除的。

sentences.en: Please make all checks payable to CCTRC are tax deductible. Thank you.
sentences.cn: 奉献收据可作为减税之用,支票抬头请写CCTRC, 谢谢!

sentences.en: Sponsorship of HK $ 100 or above is tax - deductible with a receipt.
sentences.cn: 捐款100港元或以上将获发收据作扣税用.

sentences.en: The insured need to pay the deductible contained in the policy.
sentences.cn: 被保险人需自行承担保单规定之自负额.

sentences.en: The money is deductible from taxable income.
sentences.cn: 这笔款项可从应征税的公司收入中扣除.

sentences.en: These costs are deductible from profits.
sentences.cn: 这些费用可从利润中扣除。

sentences.en: What are emily chanthe permissible deductible items in computing the appreciation value?
sentences.cn: 计算增值额时,有哪些项目允许扣除?

phrases.tran_cn: 可扣除的税款；可减免课税的

trans.tran_en: If a payment or expense is deductible, it can be deducted from another sum such as your income, for example, when calculating how much income tax you have to pay

trans.tran_cn: 免赔率； 免赔额； 扣除额
trans.tran_en: A deductible is a sum of money which an insured person has to pay toward the cost of an insurance claim. The insurance company pays the rest.
